section.name: Document Type Tutorial
section.p: Creating and editing document types using the document type editor is very straightforward. This tutorial will guide you through creating your first document type, and show how easy it actually is!

ul.li: Log in to Hippo CMS as 'admin'.
Select the 'Browse' tab by clicking on the folder icon on the left side of the screen.
Select 'Configuration' in the first column. One or more so-called 'namespaces' will be listed. Each document type exists in exactly one namespace.

Select the namespace for your project, or create a new namepace. If you are using the Quickstart package, just select the 'defaultcontent' namespace. The document types inside the selected namespace will be listed in the second column.

li.p: Create a new document type by choosing 'Create new type' in the dropdown menu.

img.alt: screenshot detail of 'create new type' action

li.p: Name the document type 'person' in the dialog that appears, and click 'OK'. The new 'person' document type will appear in the list in the second column from the left.

img.alt: screenshot detail of 'create new type' dialog

ul.li: Select the newly created 'person' document type by clicking on its name. A tab will appear showing the document type's fields. Since you just created the type, it has no fields so it will show empty in the tab.
Click on 'Edit' to open the document type in the editor.
